ygData.subject: Fw: [EverQuest] Digest Number 1282
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From what I remember, you get a skillup faster by doing trivials closer to your skill level, because according to the formula used, you have a better
ygData.messageBody:
> <<Thank you. I was at 21 in alchemy a few hours ago. I brought it up to 23
> making Distillate of Alacrity I. I have a long way to go before it will be
> worth the expense in failures to do a Clarity X. I'm just a level 44
> kitty.

> Do you bring the points up faster if you mix the more advanced stuff? I'm
> just asking because I really don't know.
>
>I got two shawls doing Great Divide quests. The Giants in the Great Divide
>don't like me anymore. G.

From what I remember, you get a skillup faster by doing trivials closer to
your skill level, because according to the formula used, you have a better
chance to get a skill-up from a success than from a failure. Eqtraders.com
has a very nice tradeskill guide on their message board in the tradeskill
guide section. If I remember correctly, it's possible to get to 210 using
nothing but store bought components, but don't quote me on that.

--Viirus Steelhart
75 Druid
Tunare
